page.title: 01Farmland East of Kington
page.content: This are provides a good example of the current trend in agriculture to diversify from the more traditional farming methods. There is much less beef, sheep have very slightly increased and more corn is grown, but now there is also potatoes,currants, relatively new cider orchards, pig units, a turkey unit and several broiler sheds housing a total of 160000 birds. Offas dyke, runs intermittantly down the west of this area, passing through Lyonshall park. There are some unusuall businesses in the area, which offer local employment,including Burgoynes Marquee hire firm and a British Wool marketing board store and grading centre. Lyonshall has a very active community with a large number of societies meting in the village hall
